results.title: Interaction
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 1 of a series of films for managers. Examines the importance of interpersonal skills in a manager’s job and discusses the need for managers to adapt their behaviour to different situations. Stresses the need for interaction and good verbal communication skills with staff. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Inter-varsity rifle match
results.brief_description: Opening sequence shows the trophy shield with six state emblems on it and also shot of ABC film crew filming the shield. Competitors are shown on location at Williamstown Rifle Range on a very cold wintry day. Entire film devoted to shots of the competing teams with occasional view of the progressive scores. NSW won and a team is shown with the trophy at the end of the film. Vehicles of the time are shown parked near the competing area. Silent film of historical interest. No credits provided.

results.title: Intelligence: a complex concept
results.creator_credit: Coast Community College District and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: What is intelligence? There are hundreds of different ideas about the nature of intelligence. Reveals that there is confusion between what intelligence is as tests measure it and what intelligence is in everyday life.

results.title: Intelligence
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Linda Jassim and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
How do you quantify differences in intelligence? How is intelligence determined? How can it be measured? Is it related to the brain? Can it ever be defined? Does heredity or experience define the upper limit of intelligence and what is the relationship between intelligence and motivation? These questions and the usefulness of intelligence tests are considered by a variety of psychologists.

results.title: Intellectually disabled offenders and victims (Kit)
results.brief_description: This educational kit is a collaborative effort by Victoria Police, the Office of public advocacy and Community Services Victoria. It is aimed primarily at police officers who are unaware of intellectual disability and how to treat offenders who are afflicted with this disability. It contains a video, teachers notes and overhead slides suitable for a group presentation. The video presents a number of scenarios involving intellectualy disabled people and potential outcomes.
